Dear Jennifer Leys:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
10/16/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12203 Financial stability
• (1) An agency shall demonstrate sufficient
financing, on an ongoing basis, to ensure the
agency is carrying out its programs and meeting
the requirements for licensing. A plan of financing
must include all the following:
• (e) An audit of all financial accounts
conducted annually by an independent
certified public accountant not
administratively related to the agency. A
copy of the audit shall be available to the
department upon request.
The agency did not have an annual financial audit completed by a certified public
accountant.

• No consultation was requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
2

• New staff orientation forms were not consistent across all files reviewed. It
was recommended the orientation forms be updated to capture all required
training topics.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment documented an unplanned disrupted
placement due to a birth mother appealing her prior release of rights followed by
the adoptive parents withdrawing their adoption petition. The chief administrator
assessed the agency social workers could have done nothing differently to
prepare, educate, and support the birth mother as well as the adoptive parents.
The only compliance issue identified was with one particular worker providing the
adoption application prior to orientation, which was addressed with that worker.
Financial Overview
The agency's budget as well as CPA prepared financial statements, statement of
financial position, statement of activities, statement of financial position, statement
of activities by month, and statement of activities comparison were reviewed No
financial concerns were identified within those documents. The agency is being
cited as they did not obtain an annual financial audit as required.
Staff Interviews
No concerns were reported by the staff members interviewed. They have
implemented the licensing rules related foster homes and adoption, as needed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space and equipment to provide for the delivery of
foster home certification, foster care, and adoption services. Closed adoption files
are stored securely in a room dedicated to the files. Open adoption files as well as
foster care and foster home files are stored in a separate room. Physical CHRIS is
stored within a locked cabinet within the file room. A cross shredder is located in
the building.
3

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
